flawed_nl_solution:
The second level has 90 + 8 = <<90+8=98>>98 parking spaces.
The third level has 98 + 12 = <<98+12=110>>110 parking spaces.
The fourth level has 110 - 9 = <<110-9=110>>110 parking spaces.
So the parking garage can accommodate 90 + 98 + 110 + 110 = <<90+98+110+110=408>>408 cars.
Thus, the parking garage can still accommodate 408 - 100 = <<408-100=308>>308 cars.
#### 308

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 101, not 110. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
